headline: Western Digital Expands Buybacks As AI Storage Roadmap Targets 100TB Drives
summary: Western Digital (NasdaqGS:WDC) has approved a $4 billion increase in its share repurchase authorization. The company also outlined a next generation storage roadmap that targets HDD capacities above 100TB by 2029. Management highlighted AI driven workloads and future enterprise and hyperscale demand as key focus areas for the new roadmap. Western Digital comes into this announcement with its shares at $273.74 and a value score of 1. The stock has logged a 29.0% return over the past 30 days...
